newsitem.title: FRANCE: SOCCER-FRANCE COME FROM BEHIND TO BEAT DUTCH 2-1.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-FRANCE COME FROM BEHIND TO BEAT DUTCH 2-1.

text.p: Substitutes Patrice Loko and Robert Pires scored in the final 16 minutes to give 1998 World Cup hosts France a 2-1 win over the Netherlands in a friendly on Wednesday.
Arsenal striker Dennis Bergkamp put the Dutch ahead in the third minute when he rifled a 25-metre shot past Bernard Lama in the French goal.

Bergkamp could have put the match beyond the reach of the French in the 12th minute when he broke away again but his shot from the right was blocked on the line by France's stand-in captain Laurent Blanc.
It was France's second victory over the Dutch in three meetings since coach Aime Jacquet took charge.
The last time the two sides met in the Euro 96 quarter-finals France won on penalties after a 0-0 draw.
